I called on Health and Human Services Sec. Azar to quickly produce factual and informative materials that are easily accessible for everyone! We must do all we can to ensure every person in America has the information they need protect themselves and defeat this virus.

My district is home to one of the most diverse areas in our great nation, including many who live in our Hmong and Punjabi communities. But the lack of information for those who don’t use English as their first language puts them and their families at great risk.

This public health crisis underscores a simple truth: where you live shouldn’t determine your access to the internet. Our students, workers, and families need Congress to invest in expanding high-speed broadband access immediately! #FamiliesFirst https://t.co/nPjxNbMXiV

Growing homegrown doctors is the best way we can tackle that shortage, and Enid is helping

Congratulations, Enid! We are so happy we get to keep you in our community!

Enid is a first-generation college student who has dedicated her career to improving healthcare for Central Valley residents. We have a shortage of qualified medical providers in our area, and we need quality doctors now more than ever.

Today is ‘Match Day’, when medical students across the country find out where they will complete their medical training. I am happy to announce that Enid Picart – my guest as this year’s State of the Union – matched right here in the valley! https://t.co/kw7dmSdZbc

Food and Agriculture is one such critical industry. We need our farmers and ag laborers to keep our food supply chain up and running. Thank you #FoodAndAg community for putting healthy food on our dinner tables every day! https://t.co/ebXYK2ghQG

The unpredictable weather patterns of Climate Change and these allocations further demonstrate the importance of bringing state and federal parties to the table to work together on California’s water future.

We already see the benefits, with new business investments in our communities and more high-paying jobs. This is the time to bring our transportation infrastructure into the 21st century. We can, and we will, get this job done!

California is leading the nation in building clean train technology, which will get cars off the road and improve our air quality. I introduced a bill to provide funding for completing High Speed Rail in California. https://t.co/kusj9nVV7w
Did you know, 1 #HSR rider can help eliminate 189lbs of CO2 emissions. An average train of 330 riders can eliminate up to 28 metric tons of CO2. #combatclimatecrisis https://t.co/BmQzKeVnI2

In the SJV, 3,500 construction workers have been dispatched to work on 119 miles of #HSR infrastructure on 30 active sites. More than 500 small businesses were put to work because of this project. The evidence clear, High Speed Rail drives economic growth. #IWillRide https://t.co/rVGwjNu6ot
HAPPENING NOW: Rep. Costa introduces new legislation to fund High Speed Rail development in California and nationwide.#HSR #IWillRide https://t.co/ulEwniD1uh

We had a positive discussion about state and federal efforts to fix our roads and bridges and my work to continue developing High Speed Rail in California. https://t.co/oAZCdKWd0B

We have a physician shortage in the SJV and students like Enid are the answer to how we solve that problem. Students who can find quality education near their homes are more likely to stay after graduation.

My guest for the #SOTU is Enid Picart, a medical student in the San Joaquin Valley PRIME program in Fresno. She’s a valley native and first generation college student who wants to stay and practice medicine in the area after finishing school. #healthcare https://t.co/nJiNU3RC73
Tom Flores is more than worthy of being recognized by the Hall of Fame. I'm proud to have introduced a resolution calling for him to be! https://t.co/MPXxxGwV52

Happy to partner with @RepJoshHarder on a bill to fight nutria in the Valley. Nutria are wreaking havoc on our water infrastructure, destroying canals, levees, wetlands, and crops. I’m pleased @RepRaulGrijalva and the @NRDems voted to advance it yesterday.
https://t.co/ZZt3D2TCKE

Last week I introduced the Expanding Medical Education Act to help combat that crisis, providing funding to promote medical training in areas of high need, with a focus on diverse and medically deprived communities.

The U.S. is expected to face a massive shortfall of primary care doctors in the next 15 years with rural and low-income communities expected to feel the brunt of this shortage.

https://t.co/j0blpkGi6s https://t.co/ZebWUM1fW8
I recently helped introduce legislation to expand drinking water access for disadvantaged communities and make vital repairs to our water infrastructure that will increase storage and supply.

Water is the lifeblood of our Valley. At today's hearing I questioned one Bureau of Reclamation official about the lack of funding to address our water crisis. 
https://t.co/NmrSqotDgB

HAPPENING NOW: Water, Oceans, and Wildlife Subcommittee is holding a hearing on important legislation, which I helped introduce to provide clean drinking water to under served communities and make repairs to infrastructure vital to water access in our Valley. https://t.co/a2So09uSzn
I am proud to sponsor this bill which supports efforts to promote understanding about the Shoah and the dangers of intolerance in our time. #NeverAgain.
On this Int'l #HolocaustRemembranceDay, 75 years after the liberation of Auschwitz-Birkenau, where nearly 1 million Jews were killed, we passed #HR943 with strong bipartisan support.

We have lost a American basketball icon whose influence for good went beyond the NBA courts he dominated for 20 years. For his daughter & he who have tragically been taken, we keep them and their family in our thoughts & prayers. https://t.co/Sg1IuPyxpa

Growing our own doctors is the only way to confront this medical crisis. I will fight for every dollar to ensure Valley residents have access to the healthcare they deserve!
https://t.co/mG7WRagjmK https://t.co/O590aNG37L

This week I had a chance to visit with students at Delhi Middle School, who recently wrote to me about issues that are important to them. I'm proud to see them exercising their political voice at such a young age. https://t.co/Z13RBMNmyj
Growing our own doctors is the only way to confront this medical crisis. I will fight for every dollar to ensure Valley residents have access to the healthcare they deserve.

For 40 years, I have supported building a medical school in the Valley. While in the state legislature, I secured the funding for the downtown UCSF-Fresno campus, and now, in Congress, I am working to deliver funding to help this program expand.

HR 5654, The Expanding Medical Education Act of 2020 is a significant investment in medical education and will help UCSF-Fresno strengthen and expand its program to train doctors. https://t.co/kXLFK54no4
Today I announced legislation, that will provide $200 million dollars to expand medial education and address the physician shortage in the valley. https://t.co/gceMAimB1h
I’m hopeful this state initiative can build on the work we’ve already done to transform lives and help our vulnerable populations find a safe place to call home.

More recently, I led the effort to secure $2 billion in grants, loans, and related assistance for rural housing projects in the December 18, 2019 spending bill and cosponsored fellow Valley Rep. Josh Harder’s bill to funnel additional federal money to resolve the homeless crisis.
By securing money for the Veterans Affairs Supportive Housing program, we’ve also been successful in significantly reducing the number of homeless veterans in Fresno and Merced.

Throughout my career, I’ve worked to combat homelessness both in the CA State Legislature and here in Congress. I’ve helped secure tens of millions of federal dollars to address this issue through programs like Continuum of Care and various other HUD initiatives.
